oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Effect And Implantation Of International Financial Reporting Standards In Taiwan-An Empirical Study Of Accounting Professionals
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chang, Powei
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: International Financial Reporting Standards
International Accounting Standards
Convergence
Adoption
Accounting Professionals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The increasing globalization of capital markets and the proliferation of multinational enterprises have made convergence of financial reporting standards become an important and urgent issue. At present, convergence with the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS, formerly the International Accounting Standards, and IAS) issued by the International Accounting Standards Board appears to be the approach that most countries agree. The current study assesses the feasibility of complete convergence with IFRS in Taiwan. Based on the prior literature, I characterize the financial reporting environment by the factors that may facilitate or impede the adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards. These factors include technical issues, timing, cost, IFRSs expertise, systems, and integrate Drawing on these factors; I develop 10 hypotheses for empirical examination. The empirical test based on the 331 responses obtained from CPAs, CPBs, auditors, accounting officers, accounting teachers, financial teachers, financial consultants yields the following findings. First, the 10 hypotheses are rejected. The timing of adopting IFRSs is the largest impediment. Second, the stakeholders are optimistic to know the benefits of adopting IFRSs. Finally, respondents are consistent in agreeing with the approach that Taiwan should translate IFRSs by Accounting Research and Development Foundation (ARDF), and then modify IFRSs for SMEs by ARDF, and finally adopt IFRSs for SMEs during 2015-2016

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Effect of Culture on Consumer Behavior related To Food and Drink A Comparative Study of Undergraduate Students in Vietnam and Taiwan
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Phan Thanh Phu
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Consumer Behavior
National Culture
Gender
Hofstede Dimensions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: As increasing in number of consumers from all over the world come in contact with the material goods and lifestyle of people living in other countries, and as the number of middle class consumers grows in developing countries, marketers are eager to locate these new customers and to offer them their products. It is often difficult for a company planning to do business in foreign country to undertake cross-cultural consumer research and how their customers perceive product. Therefore, this study aims to investigate the perception of consumer via culture analysis. The result will (try to) shows relevant and evidence for consumer behavior. Proposal of this paper provides general theories for present topic. Consumer behaviors vary with social changes and culture is a vital indicator. However, this study focuses on formal consumer behavior theories and cultural influences based on Hofstede dimensions national cultural. An analysis of these dimensions will be analyzed for consumers in Vietnam and Taiwan. Final, a survey was conducted to find out those the differences are between Vietnamese students and Taiwanese students for consumer behavior. A total of 367 respondents, including 140 Vietnamese students and 226 Taiwanese students, took part in the study. The results indicated that there is statistic significant difference in product choice, brand and dealers choice of food and drink; however, there is no significant difference in time spent to eat and drink. Another interesting result was that the gender has effect on food consumers while no clear effect on drink consumer. These results support for 2012 score of Hofstede dimensions national cultural in Vietnam and Taiwan.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Exploration Of Medical Resources Utilization In The Diabetes With Cardiovascular Diaease Patients In Taiwan
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Liao, Chienyu
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Diabetes
Diabetes With Cardiovascular
Medical Resource Utilization
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Diabetes is one of the most concern diseases for many countries. Because of its high prevalence, the population of patients with diabetes and cardiovascular diseases would growth.In Taiwan, diabetes has been ranked the top five of the people leading cause of death, and the prevalence has also been an increase to 9.2%, therefore this study is a research about medical resource utilization of patients with diabetes and cardiovascular diseases by using the 2006 National Health Insurance Research Database.The results showed that, whether patients with diabetes and cardiovascular diseases, age, socioeconomic status and Charlson comorbidity index were statistically significant differences in outpatient visits and hospital days. Terms of gender, women's outpatient visits was significantly higher than men, but the number of hospitalizations was significantly lower than men, while the average number of days in hospital is not significant differences. The results also showed that patients with diabetes had more than one cardiovascular disease; the medical resource utilization would become higher.The conclusion of this study is that patients with diabetes and cardiovascular diseases have more impact of medical resource utilization than not associated with cardiovascular disease patients, therefore, it need to follow up this study for long-term in order to understand the medical resource utilization of diabetic patients with cardiovascular disease.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Study On Residual Stress And Angular Distortion Of GTA Welding For Aluminum Alloy 7075
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chung, Chiaowei
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: X-ray
GTAW
Aluminum Alloy
XRD
Residual Stress
Angular Distortion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: (GTAW)7075X-ray3D

Aluminum alloy is one of the most commonly used metal materials in the industry. The employment of aluminum alloy welded structure is increasing with the rapid technology and industrial economic growth. A more intensive research of the weldability of aluminum alloys is demanded. The popularity of aluminum alloys promotes the development of welding techniques of aluminum alloys, while the development of welding techniques expand the application area of aluminum alloys. Therefore, welding techniques of aluminum alloys becomes one of the researching hotspots. The study aims to investigates to use GTAW to process welding 7075 aluminum alloy weldment at different preparation angles, and measure the residual stress after welding by X-ray diffraction along with measurement of the angular distortion welding by 3D image measuring equipment. It includes two parts. The first part investigates the residual stress of weldment. The result shows that the residual stress will increases with the preparation angle. The second part investigates the angular distortion of weldment. Experimental results demonstrate the preparation angle affected the angular distortion of the weldment, the angular distortion tended to increase with the preparation angle. Therefore, the preparation angles and residual stress of weldment and its angular distortion after welding are direct proportion. To find out the reasonthe welding residual stress and angular distortion result from the shape and size variation of weldment due to the welding thermal process and internal stress while welding. The uneven temperature field and partial plastic deformation during the welding process is the fundamental reason of welding stress and Angular Distortion.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Study On The Effect Of The Surface Forces At Squeeze Elastohydrodynamic Lubrication Motion With Surface Roughness
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wu, Boji
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Surface Roughness
Surface Force
Elastohydrodynamic Lubrication
Squeezing Film
Constant Loading
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: EHLdimpleC5nm

In this study, the pure squeeze elastohydrodynamic lubrication (EHL) motion of circular contacts with surface roughness in the presence of a transverse magnetic field is explored at constant loading. the coupled transient-modified Reynolds, the Load balance equation, the Rheology equation, and the elasticity deformation, are all solved simultaneously at constant loading, thus obtaining the transient pressure profiles, film shapes and normal squeeze velocities. The result revealed that the squeeze effects lead to elastic deformation of steel ball, and produced dimple. Therefore, the central film thickness and minimum film thicknesses begine to separate, and dimple depth and pressure of the contact center reach maximum contact in the center. The closer the steel balls were to the outer edge, the smaller the depth and pressure of the dimple. The effect produced by the circular type, central film thickness and minimum film thicknesses would be highest, pressure profiles would be lowest. This effect was modulated by the radial. Central film thickness and minimum film thicknesses would be lowest, pressure profiles would be highest. In addition, when the surface roughness height increases, the enhancing effect became more obvious. The simulation results reveal that the differences between radial type roughness and circular type roughness problems are apparent as the film thickness is thinner than 5 nm. The oscillation phenomena in pressure and film thickness come mainly from the action of solvation forces. The effects of surface forces become significant as the film thickness becomes thinner. The film thickness with circular type roughness is thicker than that with radial type roughness.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Parametrical Analysis For The Numerical Simulation On Staircase-like Vortex Shedding Frequency Downstream Of A Tapered Cylinder
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zhan, Bowen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: CFD
Tapered Cylinder
Staircase-like Vortex Shedding Frequency
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Strouhal609LES0.4

In this thesis, we studied numerical parameters on the phenomenon of staircase-like vortex shedding frequency axially behind the vortex generator in a duct. Preprocessor was used for non-structural grid construction for calculation, thereafter the mesh exported to CFD software for flow-field analysis and result discussion. This study has successfully simulated the vortex shedding frequency showing staircase-like phenomenon downstream of the tapered cylinder, and it is consistent with the experimental data. To reduce the discrepancy between numerical results and experimental data, parameters, such as grid number, grid distribution and numbers of computational segment for the tapered cylinder axially have been analyzed and discussed. We found those parameters affect the Srouhal number apparently. In addition, the Reynolds number at the entrance, turbulence intensity and turbulence model also play an important role on the numerical results. The case with simulated conditions by non-structured grids of 0.6 million, the nine segments along the tapered cylinder, the LES turbulence model and turbulence intensity of 0.4% show the most favorable results to the literature experimental data among our parametrical studies.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Wireless Speed Control System For DC Motors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Shiu, Hungyi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: DC
wireless speed control
Arduino
DC motor
variant load
time delay
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Arduino DuemilanoveDCVisual BasicIF-THENArduinoArduinoArduinoDCDC

This thesis used Arduino Duemilanove standard board as the platform to connect the motor control board and the rotary encoder and to communicate with the host computer wirelessly through the wireless module. The host computer received the rotational speed information from the Arduino board wirelessly. It utilized the encoder signal, the load variance and wireless time delay to decide the necessary voltage regulation by using the VB IF-THEN rule base. The host computer transmitted the regulation signal to Arduino board wirelessly. The Arduino board regulated the voltage delivered to the motor control board to control the rotational speed of the DC motor. Under the variant load condition, the purpose of motor speed maintenance was accomplished. This research discussed the topic of the wireless speed control problem of DC motors which may apply to the cases, such as the AGV of a product line, Ferris wheel and merry-go-round, etc.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects Of Albedo Of Roof Insulation Materials On Surface Temperature
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Deng, Weiyuan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Urban Heat Island Effect
Insulating Paint
Surface Temperature
Albedo
Cool Roof Technology
Green Building Codes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 80% LEEDIGBCBREEAMSBTOOLCASBEEEEWH(CRRC) 52723.8

The cause of the urban heat island effect is using a large number of low-albedo materials in urban area. These materials easily absorbing incoming solar radiation caused the ambient temperature kept continuosly in higher degrees, making urban livability lower, increasing in air conditioning power consumption, and increasing thermally induced disease incidence. Currently many countries have committed to the improvement of the urban heat island effect. The mitigation measures include technology of cool planting, cool landscape, and cool surface. Because the roofs and pavements account for by 80% of the urban area in Taiwan, it will have very significant benefits for improving the overall ambient temperature in urban area if we are able to improve the albedo of roofs and pavements. In this reserch, several major international green building codes and grading systems are compiled, including the U.S. LEED, India IGBC, British BREEAM, Canada SBTOOL, and Japan CASBEE. The requirements related to the urban heat island mitigation measures are studied, and compared with Taiwans green building codes EEWH. Some recommendations for improving Taiwans green building system are proposed. This research also compiled cool roof technology and related codes and regulations, and the data of solar reflectance, thermal emissimity and solar reflectance index of coatings products collected in the official website of Cool Roof Rating Council (CRRC). It can be used as a basis for choosing coating for practical application and can be used as a reference for reforming Taiwans codes of heat island effect mitigation measures in the future. This research carried out experiments on the measrements of temperature reduction effects for several different brands of insulation coatings. Among these coatings, five kinds of different brands insulation coatings and two kinds of general coatings are used. Two kinds of substrates namely, cement mortar specimens and galvanized iron, are painted to conduct experiment respectively. After the completion of spraying paints on the specimens, the specimens are placed in the foam board and moved to outdoor for accepting solar radiation to heat the specimens. Thermocouple temperature line and data logger are used to automatically record temperature data. The temperature data measured show that the cooling effect of the insulation coating is quite significant. Comparing the temperatures of cement mortar specimens using insulating coating with no coating it is found that the maximum temperature difference is up to 7. For galvanized iron specimens, the maximum temperature difference is up to 23.8. These results show that among the urban heat island mitigation measures the use of insulating coating on the building shell such as roofs and walls can effectively reduce the surface temperature as well as preventing heat conduction into the interior to raise indoor temperature. It can enhance indoor comfort and reduce air-conditioning cooling energy consumption. Thus, it is contributed to the mitigation of urban heat island effect.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Numerical Simulation For Concrete Surface Temperatures Under Solar Radiation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Shiau, Hueiyun
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Urban Heat Island Effect
Surface Heat Balance
Abledo
Numerical Simulation
Surface Temperature
Solar Radiation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Due to the rapid industrial and commercial developments, urbanization accelerates in a fast speed, it can be seen that buildings standing adjacent to the next buildings as well as the ubiquitous artificial pavements. These buildings and artificial pavements in the city commonly possessing low albedo thermo-physical properties, easily absorb heat and elevate temperatures, coupled with the waste heat emissions from the factories, air conditionings and transportations, resulting in the urban temperature higher than the surrounding suburbs temperature for 2~ 5, this phenomenon is known as urban heat island effect. The urban heat island effect not only causes the deterioration of the urban thermal environment to lower the livability of urban area, but also causes an increase in urban air-conditioning power consumption, flooding frequency and heat-induced illness. During the day a large amount of solar shortwave radiation heat is absorbed and stored in the low albedo and high absorption materials through the building envelopes and artificial pavements, and by conduction, convection and long wave radiation heating up the temperature within the canopy layer, making the city even if at night is still in the high-temperature thermal state. The technologies for mitigating the urban heat islands collectively known as the "cool technology" can be classified as the cool planting, cool surface and cool landscape. Among these, cool surface is used for artificial pavement and building envelope. In the research of the heat island effect mitigation measures, surface heat balance equation is used to explore the solar radiation, surface longwave radiation, albedo, thermal convection coefficient, thermal conductivity, soil temperature gradient, air temperature, sky effective temperature and surface temperature which are related to the surface temperatures of materials. In this research, the surface heat balance equation is used to simulate thermal equilibrium process of concrete pavement heating and cooling, and to predict the surface temperature of the concrete pavements. By comparing the computed surface temperatures with the measured temperatures, the accuracy of the numerical prediction can be identified. Through the sensitive analysis of parameters, the researchers can further grasp the correct understanding of the impact of heat island effect factors. Our algorithms and simulation results show that the surface temperatures of the in situ concrete pavement for a full-day measurement, the average error is 2.6, the maximum error is 25.2, and the standard error is 4.7. For small specimens simulation results show that average error is 4.4, the maximum error is 26.0, the standard error is 4.6. The sensitivity analysis shows that albedo has greater influence. If we can increase the albedo effectively, it will have a better cooling effect on reducing the pavement temperature.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CPTu
A Study Of The Juang CPTu-based Liquefaction Assessing Method
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chang, Peiwen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Liquefaction
Softening
Piezocone Penetration Test
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: (liquefaction)(softening) CPTCPTCPTuCPTu (2008)(CPTu)()KocaeliAdapazariCPTu-CPTuCRROommen et al.(2010)

Early work on soil liquefaction in an earthquake, known as cyclic liquefaction that involves loss of strength and large deformation, focused on sand-like soils. For clay-like soils, significant strength losses and ground deformations in an earthquake have also been reported. However, past attempt to quantify liquefaction resistance of clay-like soils within the framework of the traditional simplified procedures had not been as successful. In this study, a unified CPTu-based model that was developed by Juang et al., for assessing the susceptibility of all soils was applied to check the availability for clay-like soils. There are three major parts in this research, first is to confirm the CPTu-based liquefaction assessing method can be used to evaluate the potential of softening for the clay-like soils. The seond part is to check the performance of three existing CPT-based models. Field cases data are applied to review those CRR models. Finally, the important part is rechecked the applicatuon of Juang (2008) proposed CPTu-based liquefaction potential assessment method on clay-like soils. The concept of Confusion Matrix was used to assess the the overall accuracy of Juang model. According to the cases study Juang CPTu-based model can be used to evaluate the liquefaction/softening potential of clay-like soils.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Analyzing Consumer's Behavior of Medical Cosmetology by Applying Data Mining Technology
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chang, Yishiung
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: RFM
Medical cosmetology
RFM analysis model
Cluster analysis
Data mining
Association rule
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: SPSSRFM

With innovation and the growth of medical cosmetology technologies in recent years, not only makes medical cosmetology industry rise gradually, but also urges more and more consumers have micro-plastic surgery. Therefore, getting further understanding of consumers medical cosmetic behavior becomes a significant study. This study takes consumers relevant data of northern medical cosmetology clinic for example, analyzing consumers relevant consumption behavior to realize their considering while having micro-plastic surgery. First of all, this research uses consumers number, consumption of date, item and money, age, gender and residence etc.. from the data of paper case history, then creating database of this medical cosmetology clinic by hand. After that, we use SPSS to analyze consumers characteristics and consumption trend. Besides, we use RFM analysis model as the basis and use cluster analysis to segment consumers into five groups. Not only we provide analysis and recommendations, but also use data mining to investigate major consumers consumption behavior and have further comparison with whole consumers. This study supply more marketing recommendations to clinic, not just partly planning on major consumers. From the analysis result, no matter major or whole consumers, age is focusing on teenagers, female consumers are above 80%, and residence is Tai-Shan. Top three popular products are clarifying laser, complex chemical peel and summer ice moisturizing import. In association rule, whole consumers generate eight rules, major consumers generate fourteen rules and there are seven rules correspond with each other. Therefore, marketing recommendations for major consumers take into account whole consumers consumption behavior.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Why the Current Poverty Line is Unable to Cover the Entire NeedyPopulation - an Analysis of Implementation in Taiwan.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yuan-Long Chien
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poverty Line
Poverty Rates
Social Assistance
Low Income
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 7%OECD

The Social Assistance is established to deal with the problem of poverty. It based on the investigation of personal income and/or family assets, adopting the Residual Model to identify the needy via the qualifiers process. The Social Assistance System is an indispensable part of social security and the final safety net for citizens basic right of survival. The passive purpose of the social assistance programs is for relieving of poor people; on the other hand, it also actively works to get the poor out of poverty. Ultimately, the aim of these aid programs is to help those low-income families to be able to become self-supporting. This study examines and analyzes the gap between the poverty rates data and the reality in Taiwan. Based on these findings, the author is trying to rethink the existing problems of the Social Assistance. Conclusions and suggestions of the research are listed below: 1. Suggestions: (1) There is necessary to concern with the standard of the Poverty Line and the Rules of Income Redistribution on the purpose of avoiding the interference between areas. Giving subsidies depend on the localize consumption levels is also suggested. (2) Thedefinition of Poverty Line should be modified by economic prospects and the statistical data of average family income and expenditure. (3) The government must reconsider and amend the definitions of the current laws of the Social Assistance, adjusting them by localization and decentralization. 2. Conclusions: To sum up, the purpose of the dissertation is an attempt to find out a new way of rethinking about the laws of the Social Assistance and the current practice. Furthermore, it anticipates constructing rational regulations for coping with the poverty issue to guarantee the social right for citizens in Taiwan.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: YouTube
YouTube Assisted Chinese Learning System - The Case of Taiwan Television Advertisement.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jhuang, Yun Jie
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Narrow Listening
HTML5
YouTube
Chinese Learning
Web Multimedia
Narrow Listening
Television Advertisement
HTML5
YouTube
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Narrow Listening HTML5YouTube

This thesis tries to use Taiwan television advertisements as Chinese teaching materials. In Taiwan, there are a lot of funny television advertisements, but for being used as teaching material they are too short and dont have enough conversations. Such drawbacks can be overcome by Narrow Listening, which is employed to group the related advertisements, producing longer teaching material and containing more conversations. Our system uses the newest web multimedia technology HTML5 and allows user to draw anything they want on the YouTube video. Teachers can encircle the object appeared in YouTube video and turn it into extra teaching material. Students can draw their own annotations on the video and also can send them as questions to teachers. We hope this drawing function can help students learn better and also hope this will become a new way of communication and discussion between students and teachers.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Impact of Transformational Leadership on Team Citizenship Behavior: The Cross-level Effects of Social Exchange Relationship
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cheng, Huanwen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Transformational Leadership
Leader-member Exchange
Team-member Exchange
Organizational Citizenship Behavior
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Past studies have confirmed that through transformational leadership, a leader may help motivate employees, form a team atmosphere and convey a shared vision to upgrade coordination and cooperation between the members. When a team has good exchange relations, it can contribute to the formation of team citizenship behavior and create excess interest. This study aimed to explore how transformational leadership influences the team-member exchange and leader-member exchange, and to further explore how these social exchanges will affect team citizenship behavior. This research conducted a questionnaire online for team members of different teams in the enterprises to complete. Questionnaires were collected finally, a total of 220, in which of 32 group team. The collected data was analyized with SPSS for validity, reliability, pearsons correlation analysis, multiple regression, hierarchical regression, and HLM for hierarchical linear modeling. This study concludes that the visionary leadership may form the sense of a team; support and recognition for a team members may strengthen the collaboration among team members; be prudent to lead with knowledge incentive to avoid adding burden among team collaboraton and destroying leader-member relations; visionary leadership and leaders support and recognition may effectively establish the relationship between them and their subordinates; the good leader-member exchange may help team members to show citizenship behavior; effective collaboration among team members may help develop and improve countermeasures; high-degree team spirit may drive members under good leader-member exchenage to help the team spontaneously, and good relations of the team members may drive them to behave more respectfully.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A REVISED EVALUATION MODEL FOR PRODUCT DESIGN IDEALITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen, Yu-Ting
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: TRIZ
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
(TRIZ)TRIZ
TRIZ

Theory of Inventive Problem Solving (TRIZ) today has reached a fairly complete theoretical system used in problem solving, but it is inadequate for the evaluation on problem solving quality. In order to enhance the ideality of the product, the concept of ideality defined in the TRIZ theory with the integration of Independence Axiom and Information Axiom of Axiomatic Design as well as Kano model theory are used to construct Ideality Evaluation Mechanism, which includes four aspects: Effective Function, Independence, Derivative Contradiction, and Cost, aiming to evaluate the quality of product improvement. This research focuses on the assessment aspects in Ideality Evaluation Mechanism to have an in-depth discussion. According to the evaluation mechanism and workflow, a revised model is proposed to strengthen those factors related to the customers demands in the design and highlight the impact caused by Derivative Contradiction. This research re-verifies the rationality of the evaluation model through case analyses and comparisons, so that the overall quality of resolving problems within the product can be promoted and optimized.
Keywords: TRIZ, Axiomatic Design, Ideality Evaluation, Product Design

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Solar Cell Cutting Process Improvement
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: WANG,ZIH-YU
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Laser MicroJet
Dry Laser
Solar Cell
Thermal Stress
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
In this research, we have made solar cells variously cutting by the two technologies of Laser MicroJet and traditional Dry Laser. For exploring which is the better manner for solar cells cutting with low loss of efficiency, the parameters of FF(Fill Factor), Rsh , and RRP(reduce rate of power) are be selected for comparison. We quartered 6-inches multi-crystalline silicon solar cell, the main cutting parameter of Laser MicroJet is to make different voltage (740~860 V) to change the energy beam of Laser, and Dry Lasers is to control different current (12.5 ~14.5A) in that experiments variant control. In the last of those cutting process, solar cells have be measured by Electro Microscopy for the observation of cross-section , leveling and slag adhere to. The result of this experiment shows that the FF of Laser MicroJet cutting solar cells are about 75%, the Rsh are 12~16 ,and the RRP are 1.8~2.9% while the FF of Dry Lasers are about 76%, the Rsh are above 16 ,and the rrp are 1.01~1.79%. Comparatively, that the cost of cutting process of Dry Laser is more cheaper and lower rrp. Laser MicroJet can cut various shapes solar cells without the effect of thermal stress, and have fine cross-section and non-broken quality. So it is better to use Water-jet guided Laser for cutting various shape solar cells.
Key words: Laser MicroJet; Dry Laser; Solar cell; Thermal Stress

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Dimension Design of New Stepping Bike with Taguchi Method
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hon-Ming Chen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bicycle
vector loop
position analysis
Taguchi method
tolerance analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: SN

As the rising need for leisure exercise activity, the multiplicities of bicycle design are necessary. According to the tendency, this paper presents a new type of bicycle with driving mechanism of a 4 bar linkage. The driving mechanism contains a slider-crank mechanism. And then the position analysis is performed with vector loop method. In this paper, we also use Taguchi method to accomplish the purpose of tolerance requirement. At first the sensitivity analysis is used to realize the need for tolerance selection for each design parameter. The SN ratios are evaluated in coordination with Taguchi Orthogonal Array. Then the worst combination of design parameters can be found. If the combination will not fail the tolerance requirement for our purpose, then we can stop the procedures for tolerance analysis. If the combination will fail, then we can upgrade the precision of design parameters which can provide more contribution on the tolerance requirement. Then the procedures are finished until the tolerance requirement is satisfied. The tolerance analysis of this paper is performed by using Taguchi method and the results show that the process is very clear and fast. This process can also reveal the effect of each parameter tolerance on requirement and it can also apply to general engineering design.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Android
Design of License-Plate Recognization System for Android
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jian-Cheng Fu
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Android
Android
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Android (Wi-Fi)WeOCRWeOCR

The application and the development of mobile devices have become more diversified with the development of smart phones and tablet PCs. Mobile device has the characteristics of easy to carry. This study of the development platform is based on the Android operating system. Through the convenience of using the smart phones to connect the network, we can build the campus of Wi-Fi wireless network to connect to the WeOCR system to recognize the license plate text. In addition, we will regularly update the database data within the mobile phone to ensure that the data for the latest information. In the system operation process, we first shot the license plate screen through on the phone lens. And then the image is cropped through the smart phone itself. The cropped image would be transferred to WeOCR on recognition through the wireless network. The results will be back to the phone system after recognition. Finally we can query through the database and it will be back to the smart phone to display the license plate owners. The research results indicate that we can reduce the check time and accuracy whether the check purchases pass or not. We can achieve both speed and accuracy of query, and easy to carry through the system.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Study on Social Marketing and Relation Network for the Nonprofit Organization: A Case Study of Promting Pediatric Medicine Safety Program
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chao-Wei Pi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nonprofit Organization
Social Marketing
Network Analysis
Pediatric Medicine Safety
Taiwan Health Care Reform Foundation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This research is the application of social marketing and network relation theories to the program of nonprofit organization. In addition to using literature review and in-depth interview to understand the strategies and outcomes of nonprofit organizations social marketing, network analysis method was applied to discuss the correlation between nonprofit organizations network relation and social marketing. This research also accesses the effectiveness and difficulties of social marketing and the effects of different types of network relation on program effectiveness. Based on the analysis results, the research findings are concluded as the following: First, the research cases Pediatric Medicine Safety Social Marketing Program matched Kotlers social marketing framework. Second, the research case interacted with the members in the network relation by sending letters, conference discussions, telephone discussions, public hearing discussions and seminar discussions. But the members had different standpoints and roles and did not recognize the cases social marketing program in the same way. Therefore, the members interaction frequency and communication relations with the research case were different. Third, the social marketing outcomes of the research case included: (a) change in governmental agencys pediatric medicine policy; (b) private organizations supports and responses; (c) Taiwan Joint Commission on Hospital Accreditation included pediatric medicine accreditation in the hospital accreditation content. The difficulties of social marketing included: (a) the types of Make Medicines Child Size in the market in Taiwan are insufficient; (b) the market for Make Medicines Child Size is small and the pharmaceutical industry is not willing to develop and make such medicine; (c) due to cost, doctors of primary clinics are not willing to prescribe expensive medicines such as Make Medicines Child Size; (d) the government has not invested any more money in the development of pediatric medicine; (e) parents do not know much about the advantages of Make Medicines Child Size and thus could not put pressure on the government and the medical institutes effectively. Fourth, the research case used press conference as the marketing strategy to interact with competent health authority which was most effective in terms of reaching the goal of social marketing program. Lastly, based on the results of the empirical analysis, suggestions were proposed regarding the promotional strategies of pediatric medicine safety for the research case, governmental agencies and private organizations. Moreover, suggestions for follow-up research projects were also proposed to provide references for pediatric medicine safety researches in the future.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Antifibrogenic Effects of Andrographis Paniculata in Human Hepatic Stellate Cells
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hsiu-Ying Tseng
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: -beta
liver fibrosis
TGF-beta
HSC-T6
Andrographis Paniculata extract
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: (collagen)(fibronectin)(Hepatic stellate cells, HSC)HSCa-SMA, a-smooth muscle actin)transforming growth factor-b, TGF-b(pro-fibrogenic)(fibrogenic)reactive oxygen species (ROS)ROSROSTGF-bHSC-T6HSCcollagenfibronectina-SMAcollagenfibronectina-SMA

The hepatic fibrosis is a chronic disease caused by a variety of factors including alcohol abuse, oxidative stress, viral infection, autoimmune diseases, and metabolic diseases. The development of hepatic fibrosis is caused by liver injury, which leads to accumulation of the extracellular matrix proteins (ECM) including type I collagen and fibronectin as well as a-smooth muscle actin (a-SMA) synthesis and deposition, thus forming the fibrous scar. Hepatic stellate cells (HSC) play a key role in the pathogenesis of liver fibrosis. The activation of HSC leads to proliferation, expression ofa-SMA, and production of large amounts of extracellular matrix proteins. The previous studies have shown that transforming growth factor (TGF)-b is a multifunctional cytokine that plays a pro-fibrogenic role in liver fibrosis by regulating proliferation and differentiation of fibrogenic cells as well as stimulating extracellular matrix proteins. It has been known that natural products exert anti-hepatic fibrogenic activity. The traditional Chinese herb Andrographispaniculata (A.P.), a plant of Family Acanthaceae and also denoted as Chuan-Chin-Lian, is used to treat cold, diarrhea, fever and, especially, for liver protection. It has been known that reactive oxygen species (ROS) is a factor involved in fibrogenesis and the extract of A.P. can also prevent the liver damage from ROS. However, the functions of A.P. in liver protection are still unclear. Therefore, we proposed that it could be a candidate for anti-fibrogenesis from liver damage via decreasing ROS. To address this issue, we used a cell model for liver fibrosis, treating with TGF-bto activate hepatic stellate cells, HSC-T6 cells. We also used Western blotting, immunofluorescent staining and trichrome staining to access the protein levels of collagen, fibronectin and a-SMA and found that these proteins were induced by TGF-b. However, the expression of these proteins was decreased while co-treating with various concentrations of A.P. extract. According to these results, A.P. extract exerts ability for inhibiting HSC activation and it may be used as a drug for preventing liver fibrosis.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Study of Keelung Residents' Attitude andCognition toward the Conservation andEcotourism Development of Black Kite,Milvusmigrans
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chou, YinPei
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Black Kite
wildlife ecotourism
Keelung Harbor
Eagle Sason
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Black Kite (Milvus migrans), commonly known as eagles, used to be the most common raptor in the plains of Taiwan. There is currently only 200 Black Kites remaining in Taiwan and it was announced that they are now classified as a secondly protected species. The Blake Kite relies on the Keelung Canal and Keelung Harbor to scavenge for offal and other animal remains. They have been feeding at and hovering over Keelung Harbor for decades. However, with the Keelung water quality improvement plan, the Black Kites face a food shortage. The importance is not just that the Black Kites will no longer appear at Keelung Harbor, but because the lack of food threatens the survival of this species. The basis of this study is that Keelung Harbor is an important feeding ground for Black Kites. The three objects we studied are: 1) Keelung residents cognition and conservation attitude towards the Black Kites, 2) the acceptance of artificial feeding of Black Kites, and 3) a questionnaire with Black Kites as the main focus, on ecotourism development and the possibility of Black Kites becoming a city symbol. The respondents opinions on Keelungs tourism attractions will be counted to the top 15 ones, and then planned for an ecological leisure one-day trip. Analysis of the 957 completed questionnaires shows that 50-70% of the respondents have inadequate knowledge and no understanding of the Black Kites ecological habits and eagle-related activities, 70% have a positive attitude towards wildlife conservation, 50% support artificial feeding but those with no opinion on this matter is as high as 30%; 80% of the respondents agree that the Black Kites are important to Keelungs environment and tourism resources, and that the public facilities near Keelung Harbor should use the Black Kites as a symbol to highlight the citys representative animal. After analysis for results, we provide five suggestions for relevant organizations and future researchers to use as a reference set when designing Black Kite related ecological education, conservation strategies, and other activities. 1. Promote volunteer training and education of the ecology of Black Kites in schools 2. Strengthen the publicity of Keelung Eagle Season activities 3. Plan for the study of Black Kite feeding stations 4. Create more eco-information on Keelung Ocean Plaza 5. Connect tourist attractions and public buildings and maintain the natural features of Keelung

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Study of the Relationship Between Consumer Perceived Quality, Perceived Value and Purchase Intention of National Apparel Brands
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pan, Yu Fang
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Perceived Quality
Perceived Value
Purchase Intention
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: UNIQLO Hang TenGiordanoUNIQLO600358 UNIQLOHang TenGiordano

As a popular Japanese fashion brand, UNIQLO, set a new base in Taipei, it brought a sensation in the clothes market, creating a fad called National Apparel Brands. In magazines, news, network, or TV, all related reports are discussed and known by all of us. Consequently, many other brands which have already thrived in Taiwan come up with many marketing ideas in the hope to be against the coming affect from UNIQLO, which has caused more notices than ever. National Apparel Brands means products with high quality, average price and the taste. For those consumers with purchasing experiences, their perceived quality, perceived values and purchasing intention, as well as the way how the three elements affect one another, are what this study aim to explore. The study mainly focuses on such three brands as Hang Ten, Giordano and UNIQLO with 600 questioneries issued and 358 effective questionnaire collected. The method adopted here is descriptive statistics,to analyze their perceived quality, perceived values and purchasing intention on National Apparel Brands. Moreover, by means of return analytic method, it aims to explore the interaction between perceived quality and purchase intention, perceived value and purchase intention, and betwewn perceived quality and purchase intention. As the results show, consumers, to some degrees, show more tendencies in purchasing UNIQLO, based on perceived quality, perceived values and purchasing intention, than Hang Ten, Giordano. Also, this study also confirms the positive line among the three elements in consumption.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Driver Perception on Level of Service at Signalized Intersection
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen, Yiwen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Spike
level of service
ordered probit model
signalized intersection
willingness to accept
spike model
contingent valuation method
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: () SpikeSpike26683481

This study takes the drivers perception into consideration to further assess the level of service at signalization intersection. Motorcycle riders and car drivers are our main targets. Videos of different levels of service were pre-recorded and then presented to the respondent in the survey. Ordered probit model was applied to estimate the effects of important factors on the drivers perception towards different levels of service at signalized intersection. Results obtained from the model showed trip, socioeconomic, road related characteristics (pavement condition, geometric design, traffic control, etc.) and weather condition were all significant variables influencing the drivers perception towards different levels of service at signalized intersection. Our results can provide a reference when planners and related authorities assess levels of service at signalized intersection. This study investigates the willingness to accept for delay times under different levels of service at signalization intersection. Motorcycle riders and car drivers are our main targets. Videos of different levels of service were pre-recorded and then presented to the respondent in the survey. Contingent valuation method was applied to design different scenarios for corresponding levels of service. Spike model was then used to obtain the willingness to accept for delay times. The results found that the willingness to accept for delay times ranges from 26 to 68 seconds for motorcycle riders, while from 34 to 81 seconds for car drivers, under different levels of service at signalized intersection. It is worth to note that the delay times are longer than the ones set in Taiwan Highway Capacity Manual, indicating Taiwanese drivers are willing to accept longer delay times under different levels of service at signalized intersection.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Study of the Closure Mechanism for Incompetent Elementary and Middle School Teachers in Taiwan
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen,Chin-Feng
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: inncompetent teacher
eacher review and evaluation committee
teacher evaluation for professional development
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The purpose of this study is to explore the closure mechanism for incompetent elementary and middle school teachers, and propose concrete suggestions based on research results. The findings can serve as a reference for education administration authorities, elementary and middle schools, and teachers. The focus of education is students, and dealing with incompetent teachers should focus on maintaining the educational rights of students, only if the students educational rights are maintained can teachers realize their professionalism, can schools become sites for educational functions and all students receive good educational quality. The existence of incompetent teachers in schools has produced many negative influences on the work morale of teaching peers at the school, students educational rights, school atmosphere, school management authority, and social perceptions of schools. However, the current closure mechanism for incompetent teachers still has many problems. Thus, this study evaluated the items under Clause 14.1 of the Teachers Act. The parts in item 7 and item 9 about uncertain legal concepts are organized through the decisions of the Executive Yuan and complaint evaluations of Taiwan Provincial Teacher Grievances Committee, to categorize inappropriate behavior damaging to the way of teachers, make it abstract, so that the determination based on uncertain legal concepts can be concretized, in order to ensure the three determination standards for incompetent teachers; poor instruction or inability to carry out ones work which evaluates the referential standards of the Ministry of Education to establish the types for the item and to concretize it. The types of incompetent teachers and concretized referential standards are established so that the evaluation criteria of the teacher review and evaluation committee on incompetent teachers can be objective to avoid different evaluation values due to personal values. With a good closure mechanism for incompetent teachers, it is possible to maintain student rights and enhance the work morale of qualified teachers. The teacher evaluation for professional development should be connected to the closure mechanism of incompetent teachers, so that the professional performance of teachers can involve feedback and reflection, self-evaluation, with positive functions in encouragement, rewards, and assistance in teacher development in their professional performance, providing benefit to students. This would allow schools to sense whether a teacher would need counseling or assistance, and remove incompetent teachers from the realm of education, encourage teachers to continue elevating their professional abilities, while also ensuring the learning rights of students.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Earnings Management and Hedging
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lai, Hung-Ching
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Earnings management
Hedge
Earnings informativeness
Derivatives
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 20042010S&P 500(future earnings response coefficients)

Using a sample of U.S. S&P 500 firms from 2004 to 2010, this study examines the impact of hedging decision on earnings management. Empirical results indicate that hedged firms and firms with higher hedge ratio conduct less earnings management and reveal better earnings quality. Further, this study uses future earnings response coefficient, denoted by FREC, as proxy of earnings informativeness to investigate the impact of hedging decision on earnings informativeness. The results show that earnings of firms with high hedge ratio are more informativeness, suggesting that hedging decision can improve earnings informativeness. These findings are robust to different analysis models controlling endogenous problem and simultaneous decision problem.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A self narratives research about ethnic identity of an acquired-indigenous-peoples-status person.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jeng, Tung
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: aboriginals identity
biethnics
self identity
self narratives
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a self research of self identity between Hans and Aboriginals. It inquires the change process from Hans identity to Aboriginals identity. Grew up in a society that collective unconsciously blank Aboriginals out, the narrator learned to conceal her identity of Aboriginals in her early life. Up to a given point in adulthood, the narrator recognized and took back her Aboriginals identity by means of search and self reflection. In the taking back process, the narrator broke through the impasse between two identities, and achieved a fluid and free self identity. In the changing process, the turning point took place in ethnic contact experiences. The contacts opened new experiences and a new field of view, therefore the rigid shackles was released. Finally, the narrator aware the struggle of ethnic identity is a peculiar issue to biethnics.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Influence of Hedonic and Utilitarian Value on Tourism Engagement
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chou, Peiyi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hedonic
Utilitarian
Engagement
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: OBrien(2010)(engagement)Batra Ahtola (1991)()()(Chon, 1990) Babin(1994)OBrienTom(2010)201256

Engagement has been defined as a quality of user experience (OBrien &Tom, 2010). Expereince has become a product attribute in the economical sense, a value added element used to differentiate goods and services (Pine and Gilmore, 1999). This view of engagement recognizes usability as an essential variable for an endurable outcome, one that allows users to perceive the experience as worthwhile, successful, and one they would seek again in future (OBrien, 2010). Batra and Ahtola (1991) stated that consumers purchase services and perform consumption behaviors for two basic reasons: (1) consummatory affective (hedonic) gratification (from sensory attributes), and (2) instrumental, utilitarian reasons. In recreation or tourism, the environment of destination is regarded as the product, and the experience is regarded as the service. This aim of this study was to explore the impact of hedonic and utilitarian values on environmental user engagement. This study adopt this two-dimensional conceptualization (hedonic and utilitarian) of consumer values: the first dimension is a hedonic dimension resulting from sensations derived from the experience in the destination environment, and the second is utilitarian dimension derived from functions performed by destination environment. This study aimed to predict visitors environmental engagement attitude in the destination by the two-dimensional values. This study was conducted in Pinglin, which is one of the important location of the Green Community in Taiwan. Data was collected by questionnaire interview in May and June, 2012. The findings of the study shows that the visitors environmental engagement in the destination were influenced by their hedonic and utilitarian values. The results demonstrated the dimensiom of Perceived Usability, Aesthetics, Endurability and Felt Involvement can predict tourists behavior intention in the future. Managers must be clear what motivated cognition to motivate tourists to make tourism decisions and consumer attitude, for the sake of providing the right product to the target market and attempting to develop models that explain a greater proportion of the variance in tourists behavior.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Using Investment Model to Investigate the Environment Commitment, Willingness to Sacrifice and Persistence
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen, YingYu
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Commitment to environment
Investment model
Willingness to sacrifice
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: (Davis et al. 2009)Rusbult (1980)Davis et al. (2009) 201256

Commitment is theorized to emerge from structural interdependence with the environment and to lead to pro-environmental behaviors. The commitment whether or not individuals feel close or connected to nature, they are interdependent with nature in the sense that the well-being of nature can affect the well-being of individuals (Davis et al., 2009). Rusbult (1980) extended interdependence theory by developing a theory-The Investment Model about relationship commitment that is recognized as one of the leading theories in interpersonal relationships psychology. The natural environment may be viewed as a relationship partner with whom individuals experience greater or lesser commitment. Commitment to the natural environment is a new theoretical construct that predicts environmental behavior. Davis et al. (2009) provided evidence that commitment to the environment predicts individuals past environmental behaviors as well as their environmental behavioral intentions. The purpose of this study is to understanding of commitment through the Investment Model in natural environment by the tourists. This study was conducted in Pinglin, which is one of the important location of the Low Carbon Community in Taiwan and Daan park and National Taiwan University which is one of the important location of the Leisure site in Taipei Data was collected by questionnaire interview in May and June, 2012.The findings of the study indicate that in the Regression Analysis, whether Pinglin or Daan park and National Taiwan University, visitors satisfaction level and investment size can predict the commitment to the environment; visitors quality of alternatives can not predict the commitment to the environment. The commitment and willingness to sacrifice can predict the persistence on site. However the willingness to sacrifice is a mediator to the commitment and the persistence on non site.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Responsibility and Regulation of Shadow Director and De Facto Director
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cheng, Hsiang-Chih
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: de facto director
shadow director
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: de jure director shadow directorde facto director

Before the amendment to the Company Act (the "CA"), directors are responsible persons of a company in accordance with Article 8 of the CA. There is no argument that directors are the de jure director elected through legal procedures. However, a person, who is not acting as a director, having similar operational power or privilege as a director is quite common in current practice. It will lead to serious breach to the regulations of corporate governance if the abovementioned person is not subject to the responsibility system of directors. The voices for adding regulations governing shadow directors and de facto directors have been existed in academia for a long time. After a long-term discussion, Paragraph 3, Article 8 of the CA has finally been added at the beginning of 2012. It is a milestone of the company legislations for officially introducing regulations governing shadow directors and de facto directors. However, it needs further clarification for the definition/recognition, application and the responsibility scope of shadow directors and dse facto directors before the courts and regulators having enough experience and cases. For such issues, the verdicts and latest regulations regarding the shadow director and de facto director under England legislations existed for a long period may provide certain inspiration. Therefore, this thesis will analyze the CA of Taiwan in 2006 and important verdicts of England courts and compare with the problem and handling of shadow directors and de facto directors in practice before the amendment to the CA in the view of corporate governance and agent issues. Furthermore, this thesis will also provide the preliminary explanation of the new regulations of preliminary and advice for the derivative problems after introducing such regulations in order to gather and appreciate more valuable opinions.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A study on influence of original familys triangulation types on marital conflict strategies
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen,Liken
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: triangulation
marital conflict coping strategies
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The main purpose of this study was an attempt to obtain new types of triangulation and to reconstruct the triangulation theory of family therapy. It also aims to analyze married peoples differences on triangulation and their marital conflict coping strategies. Besides, this study wanted to explore the relations between triangulation and marital conflict coping strategies. 304 married people in Taipei area were sampled, and questionnaires Triangulation Scale and Conflict Coping Strategies Scale were used to collect data. Data obtained was analyzed by descriptive statistics, cluster analysis, Chi-square, one-way ANOVA and independent-sample T test. The results of this study are as follow: 1. It describes the meanings of triangulation and obtains three new types of triangulation, which are emotional disengagement, Parentification and enmeshment co-independence. 2. There are no significant differences on the different genders, birth order and parents marital status of married people among emotional disengagement, Parentification, and enmeshment co-independence. 3. There is significant difference on the different genders among tolerance and acquiescence endurance, self-harm, and roundabout appeal; there is significant difference on the birth order among tolerance and acquiescence endurance and roundabout appeal, but there is no obvious difference on the birth order among the seven dimensions of marital conflict coping strategies. 4. There are significant differences on the concealment and cold war, self-harm, others intercession, and roundabout appeal among emotional disengagement, Parentification and enmeshment co-independence. Based on the results and discussion of the research, the researcher offers some suggestions for counseling practice, parental guidance and future studies.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Research of Vertical obstacles Unicom device settings in the Current Status of the Existing Building
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wan-Yu Cheng
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Maintenance of urban renewal and renovation
The project of updating old apartment
Vertical Unicom equipment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
To promote the build of the quality of barrier-free environment to live for the disable and elderly, and the building technical regulations set in 2008Public buildings for those with mobility problems to use the facilities, and start to aid vertical moving lines barrier-free in the project of urban renewal and renovation to maintain. Mainly offer both in low-rise residential buildings for those with mobility problems to access and use can tend to improve. And improve urban style and extend the life cycle of existing building and additional enhance the economic value. But for there is no hard and fast rules in the environment settings of the existing buildings shall comply with barrier-free design specifications, will still have the difficulties, user and application implementers in the implementation to set use. The result of this study is through the domestic current situation survey, comprehensive with interviews of users, setting implementers, experts and scholars to find out the problem of setting accessibility vertical Unicom device integrated into the existing buildings and recommendations for improvement as a reference of amending legislation in the future. The main results of this research as follows: 1. Put forward the problems of the current situation for the vertical Unicom equipment space conditions and give the proposal of reasonable improvement. (a). The status of the distribution rate statistics of vertical Unicom equipment set in the northern Taiwan. In the total of 14 vertical Unicom equipment share, the highest share is Beitou District, Taipei City, 29%. The second is Chungli City, 22%, Songshan District, Taipei City, 7% and the Zhongshan District, Taipei City, 7%. The remaining five regions are both 7%. (1)In the use of barrier free design specifications percentage statistics, the number of entrance to guide the scope conform: In line with set quantity is 6, do not meet the number of settings is 7, the number of not set is 1. oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fire Accident Investigation and Evaluation of Cumene Hydroperoxide (CHP)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen,Jielan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cumene hydroperoxide (CHP), differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), vent sizing package2 (VSP2), process safety management, accident investigation and evaluation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: (differential scanning calorimetry, DSC) (vent sizing package 2, VSP2) (cumene hydroperoxide, CHP) (activation energy, Ea) (exothermic onset temperature, T0) (temperature of no return) (cumene hydroperoxide, CHP) (cumene hydroperoxide, CHP) (differential scanning calorimetry, DSC) (vent sizing package 2, VSP2) (cumene hydroperoxide, CHP)

This study was used to evaluate thermal hazard of cumene hydroperoxide (CHP) using differential scanning calorimetry (DSC) and vent sizing package2 (VSP2). Activation energy (Ea), exothermic onset temperature (T0), temperature of no return etc., were employed to prevent and protect thermal explosion relevant parameters in the petrochemical industry. The cumene hydroperoxide (CHP) is a toxic chemical material that was used to mix with oxygon (O2) or air (21vol. O2) in the oxidation tower. In our previous studies, CHP has already been widely applied globally in the chemical industries, and it has been indentified as a thermally hazardous chemical materials. In this study, the aforementioned parameters of the CHP was obtained by using DSC and VSP2, were used to a standard level in process safety management for petrochemical industry. In view of fire accident investigation and evaluation, CHP should be safe handling procedures and storage situations in the chemical industries.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mechanism design of six-axis robot arm
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHUN-TENG TSAI
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Robot arm
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: (Inverse Kinematics)DSP based

The main purpose of this paper is to design a new robotic arm mechanism. It can be installed on service robots or humanoid robots to complete the work of interacting with people or services. Our laboratory has already built a service-oriented robot arm which has the belt transmission system problem caused by the small margin sloshing stops. This may cause the belt relaxation or even rupture. Designing another robot arm mechanism instead of this mechanism is a benchmark, and can be used to verify the equations of the kinematics of the robot arm. The inverse kinematics from the axes data will also be derived in advance. The five-axis robot motion control will be accomplished by using the DSP based multi-axis servo motor motion control system.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Using Finite Element Method to Analyze the Cause of Inaccuracy for a Thermal Conductivity Measurement System
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lin, Chih-Yuan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fouriers law, modified comparison method, thermal resistance theory, finite element method, film-thickness gauge
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
This study discusses the cause of the inaccuracy for a Thermal Conductivity Measurement System, which is composed of two test discs of the same material with different thickness and three identical copper cylinders assembled in series. The serial assembled test samples and standard copper cylinders are insulated with glass wool to ensure an adiabatic condition. The temperature setup and measurement can be made manually or by computer. The thermal conductivity is calculated using the modified comparison method based on Fouriers law. This modified comparison method assumes that the four thermal contact resistance are equal. Significant errors may result from this assumption.
There are significant differences in the thermal conductivity between the measured results and the actual value. This may be due to the fact that the thermal contact resistances are not equal, and that the glass wool enclosure is not thermal insulation. To explore the cause, this study uses the ideal thermal resistance theory and finite element method in a hope to reproduce the experimental results. We use a film-thickness gauge to measure the film-thickness and than calculate the heat transfer coefficient of the contact surface. With the heat transfer coefficient of contact surface, we are able to calculate the temperature distribution using the ideal thermal resistance model and finite-element method. This study shows that both models cannot reproduce the temperature distribution of the measurement system. We find that the significant amount of heat is lost from the lateral direction. The thermal properties of glass wool is not property modeled causing the difference between the simulation and measurement.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An Analysis of Value for Middle-Aged Women Learning Pressed Flower Art Teaching Activity - A Case Study of the In Love with Pressed Flower Class of Taichung Urban community College
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kao-Li Yin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pressed Flower Art
Pressed Flower Art Teaching
Middle-Aged Woman
Life Education
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pressed flower art has been passed from Europe to Asia and then from Japan to Taiwan while developed in Taiwan for a decades. The pressed flower art revolved from simple collage to todays art containing rich humanity and stories. Pressed flower has advanced to a domain of visual arts with painting, exceptional meanings of pressed flowers while offering art function. Middle-Aged women leaning creativity with pressed flower art can enrich the horizon of their life and develop art appreciation, aesthetics and ability to create. On the other hand, they can increase care for aesthetics while discovering the infinite possibilities of their life. In the case of In Love with Pressed Flower class, we observe the serious and active attitudes of middle-aged working women towards life, while the process of middle-aged women learning pressed flower is filled with surprises and touching moments. In the progress of creation, they experience the overlapping of flowers and plants while surrounded by the aroma of flowers; whereas the seemingly forgotten and the once humble plants have attained the different beauty in everyones work. The students truly perceive the intimate relationship between human and the nature, combining the emotional factors with life experience and creative performance, conveying the personal living aesthetics and emotions in life that indirectly enrich their life. Nonetheless, pressed flower art is one of the methods for discovering beauty in life while developing the value of life aesthetics, internalizing into attitudes toward life. When once perceives more and in-depth of the beauty of life will be equipped with more energy to face with challenges and overcome adversity when facing with difficulties in life. The study recorded, organized and analyzed the process and experience of middle-aged women from the In Love with Pressed Flowers Class of Taichung Urban Community College participating in the creativity of pressed flower art. The study applied in-depth interview for data collection, supplemented by work photos and relevant activity image to record the overall impact of the middle-aged woman artists and their families in the participation of learning pressed art creations. The researcher then applied the Grounded Theory to the data attained from the interview with analysis and organization, taking reference from the literature and research purpose to compile the data into four scopes, namely attitudes toward life, creativity course, learning course, and learning value as the overall appearance in middle-aged women learning pressed flower art teaching. The study discovered that the leaning value of pressed flower art for middle-aged women can be divide improvement in living quality, spiritual sustenance, and the satisfaction from the sense of achievement, harmonious life, expansion of arts and knowledge field, and embellishing life. The study further analyzed to validate the value of pressed flower art learning.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An Action Research on Promoting Students ' Drawing and Form Performance Through Picture Books Appreciation TeachingA Case Study of the Middle-Grade Elementary School Students
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Miao-Ru Chang
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: picture books
picture book appreciation teaching
drawing and form performanc
action research
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Picture books with complete graphic structures that have good stories as well as diverse painting styles are so-called creations of arts with visual effects. According to the multi-oriented researches that curriculum designs merged with picture books can achieve the specific goals of the visual art teachings. In this study, the visual elements of picture books were focused to develop the teaching modes of the course objectives with form elements and principles. In the meantime, the authors attempted to adopt the students of third and fourth grades of the elementary schools as the subjects to explore the feasibility of this mode. The authors applied action research method and started with the literature analysis to performed the instructional designs, assessed the learning outcomes of the students after the pilot teachings, and then modified the instructional designs as well as the formal teaching studies. By appreciations of picture books, the students learned the form elements and principles of the visual arts in this study. That not only improved the appreciation interests and artistic creation abilities to enhance the art perception, but also accumulated aesthetic experiences. The reviews of teachings were hold after the implementations of formal teachings and the appropriate teaching methods were considered how to use them to exert the characteristics of the picture books. We also tried to guide students to observe and recognize with the visual elements of picture books. We proposed the teaching reviews and the reflections of action research on teachings of picture books with the teaching processes and the learning outcomes of students. Finally, the authors summarized this study with the following conclusions: 1. With the guide processes of appreciation teachings, students possessed the preliminary abilities of aesthetic and expression about picture books in the meantime the observation abilities were also enhanced. 2. On the learning reflections of students, the authors found the most favorite courses that were concluded with the units of learning tables by researchers were the appreciations of classmates work pieces, which has the highest proportion of more than 60%. And among the most difficult items, the option of do not fell difficult had the highest proportion that indicated the students were competent and interested in the curricular activities designed by the researchers. 3. From the self-assessment forms of student learning activities, the students evaluated themselves with very high scores in all aspects of learning attitudes. The researchers also found that students were with full interests and curiosities in teaching processes of picture books, and they completed their creations in the pleasant atmosphere.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eight-Row Dance Creative Elements Analysis and Stationery Commodity Developed Research
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Huang, Ying-Ying
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ritual Dances
creative elements
stationery goods
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Adobe Illustrator2D 1234

Under the rapidly changing of times and society, many traditional cultures and heritages have slowly disappeared. However, the Confucius Ceremony has still been maintained for more than two thousand years. Therefore, the four purposes of this study are as follows. First, investigate the history of the Confucius Ceremony. Second, discuss the meanings of the stuff used in the ceremony. Third, analyze the elements of the stuff. Fourth, apply these elements in the design of stationary goods. This study uses the Confucius Ceremony and the Ritual Dances as the research objects. First, analyze the image features of the Confucius Ceremony with content analysis. Second, transform these elements into creative ones with development mode of creative elements of symbol translation. Third, use these creative elements in the design of stationery goods and demonstrate them in 2D models. The conclusions of the study are as follows: (1) Summarized the history of Confucius Ceremony and ritual Dances, and generalized the related artifacts function and meaning. (2) Set up the image features and color imagery of Confucius Ceremony and Ritual Dances. (3) Develop the creative elements of Confucius Ceremony and ritual Dances. (4) Using creativity and color elements to design stationery goods can show Ritual Dances cultural characteristics.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Conversion and weigh interactive role of grassroots police officers on duty
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hsu, Tsung Hsien
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: power
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Abstract This article aims to explore through Foucault's disciplinary power theory Yemei Hui gift relationship analysis, to understand the daily work of grassroots police officers. Grassroots police officers, Foucault's disciplinary power theory point of view, with the enclosed space education era from the police academy, a fixed timetable for formal requirements of the law, and informal peer life, the standard method of education, body technology the stringent requirements of the more open space in the transition to become the police (finally formed the a fixed enclosed space), to find a tradeoff survival rules indefinite duty table (i.e., a class table), never regular elastic formal and informal duty life , both fixed process seems to be just the right of re-education to some extent culture very much hope but no time with the physical training, and other characteristics, full of contradictions and the treacherous special career, scattered in the daily duty work details inside. Grassroots police officers must operate through a complex relationship to the efficiency of the work, the content of their work have to contact a lot of people, colored people, therefore, a long time ago, will inevitably develop the face of many people with experience to sophistication. This time, however, it is this vast networks of relationships include the relationship between sequence diversity gift exchange (conversion) will be able to say that logic can be black and white two opposing understand. In short, the primary police face work pressure, and, as the parties to the relationship between network nodes, tools, courier, executors, and can only weigh the profession and maneuvers of all forces to find one acceptable equilibrium point. Keywords: power, relationship, gift-relationship, interactive role, balance, weigh
